intro: Erlangea buchananii, commonly known as the Buchanan's erlang, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and pinnate leaves. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in shrubland or woodland habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
